Package algorithms.cycles

Class NPRR

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.cycles.NPRR
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NPRR_Sort
    public class NPRR
extends Object
    Worst-case optimal join algorithm from Ngo et al., JACM'98 https://doi/10.1145/3180143. Implements the simplified algorithm for simple cycles (Lemma 8.1 in the paper). Expected to be faster than the generic algorithm due to fewer hash tables needed. Does NOT sort the output.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

        public Tuple get_next()

        Tuple Returns the next output tuple (or null if none remain).

      • even_cycle

        private void even_cycle()
        Produces all the tuples of the simple cycle join for cycles of even length.

      • cartesian_product

        private void cartesian_product​(int relation_idx,
                               List<Tuple> curr_tuples)
        Performs a for loop for each relation in the Cartesian Product. Implemented recursively since the number of for loops is specified by the input. The arguments keep track of the recursion state.
        Parameters:
        relation_idx -
        curr_tuples -

      • filter

        private void filter​(int relation_idx,
                    List<Tuple> tuples_to_filter,
                    double cost_from_filters)
        Given a list of tuples from the Cartesian Product of half the relations, this recursive function filters the result against the other half. We also keep track of the cost of the tuples from the filtering relations.
        Parameters:
        relation_idx -
        tuples_to_filter -
        cost_from_filters -

        public static void main​(String[] args)
